title: Single slit - width from 2nd-order dark fringes

content.question: A laser beam is directed through a screen with a narrow vertical slit, forming a pattern that can be viewed on a second screen, as shown in the figure. The laser produces light of wavelength <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math> and is a distance <math alttext="D sub L S, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>LS</mtext></msub></math> from the slit. The slit is a distance <math alttext="D sub S V, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>SV</mtext></msub></math> from the viewing screen. On the viewing screen, the two dark fringes indicated in the front view in the figure are a distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> apart. What is the approximate width of the slit?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 lambda times D sub S V, end sub, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>λ</mi><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>SV</mtext></msub></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 lambda times D sub S V, end sub, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>λ</mi><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>SV</mtext></msub></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 lambda, times open parenthesis, D sub L S, end sub, plus D sub S V, end sub, close parenthesis, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>λ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>LS</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>SV</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 lambda, times open parenthesis, D sub L S, end sub, plus D sub S V, end sub, close parenthesis, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>λ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>LS</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>SV</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 4 lambda times D sub S V, end sub, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>λ</mi><msub><mi>D</mi><mtext>SV</mtext></msub></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
